column1: 2 ^ Deus
column2: áŭribus nostrîs aŭdívimus~; patres nostri adnuntiavérunt nobîs
column3: opus qŭod operátus es in diébus eórum
column4: et in diébus antíquîs. ^ O God
column5: we have heard with our ears~; our fathers have declared to us
column6: the work thou hast wrought in their days
column7: and in the days of old.

column1: 3 ^ Manus tua gèntes dispèrdidit et plantavìsti eos~; afflixìsti pòpulos et expulìsti eos~; ^ Thy hand destroyed the Gentiles and thou plantedst them~; thou didst afflict the people and cast them out~;
4 ^ nec ènim in gládio suo possedérunt terram
column2: et bráchium eórum non salvávit eos~; sed dèxtera tua et bráchium tuum
column4: qŭóniam complacuìsti in eîs. ^ for not by their own sword did they inherit the land
column5: and their own arm did not save them~; rather thy right hand and thy arm
column6: and the light of thy countenance
column7: because thou wast pleased with them.

column1: 5 ^ Tu es ìpse rex meus et Deus meus
column2: qŭi mandas salútes Jacóbi. ^ Thou art thyself my king and my God
column3: who commandest the saving for Jacob.

column1: 6 ^ In te inimícos nostros ventilábimus cornu
column2: et in nómine tuo spernémus insurgèntes in nobîs. ^ Through thee we will push down our enemies with the horn
column3: and through thy name we will despise them that rise up against us.

column1: 7 ^ Non ènim in arcu meo sperábo
column2: et gládius meus non salvábit me. ^ For I will not trust in my bow
column3: and my sword shall not save me.

column1: 8 ^ Salvavìsti ènim nos de affligèntibus nos
column2: et odièntes nos confudìsti. ^ But thou hast saved us from them that afflict us
column3: and hast put them to shame that hate us.

column1: 9 ^ In Deo laŭdábimur tota die
column2: et in nómine tuo confitébimur in sáĕculum. ^ In God shall we glory all the day long
column3: and in thy name we will give praise for ever.

column1: 10 ^ Nunc aŭtem repulìsti et confudìsti nos
column4: in virtútibus nostrîs. ^ But now thou hast cast us off
column8: wilt not go out with our armies.

column1: 11 ^ Avertìsti nos retrórsum post inimícos nostros
column3: diripiébant sìbi. ^ Thou hast made us turn our back to our enemies
column4: and they that hated us plundered for themselves.

column1: 12 ^ dedìsti nos tamqŭam oves escárum
column2: et in gèntibus dispersìsti nos. ^ Thou hast given us up like sheep to be eaten
column3: and thou hast scattered us among the nations.

column1: 13 ^ Vendidìsti pòpulum tuum sine prètio
column2: et non fuit multitúdo in commutatiónibus eórum. ^ Thou hast sold thy people for no price
column3: and there was no reckoning in the exchange of them.

column1: 14 ^ posuìsti nos oppróbrium vicínîs nostrîs~; subsannatiónem et derísum hîs qŭi sunt in circùmitu nostro. ^ Thou hast made us a reproach to our neighbours~; a scoff and derision to them that are round about us.
15 ^ posuìsti nos in similitúdinem gèntibus~; commotiónem cápitis in pòpulîs. ^ Thou hast made us a byword among the Gentiles~; a shaking of the head among the people.
16 ^ Tota die verecùndia mea contra me est
column2: et confúsio faciéi meaĕ coopèruit me
column3: ^ All the day long my shame is before me
column4: and the confusion of my face hath covered me

column1: 17 ^ a voce exprobrántis et obloqŭèntis
column2: a fácie inimíci et perseqŭèntis. ^ at the voice of him that reproacheth and detracteth me~; at the face of the enemy and persecutor.

column1: 18 ^ Haĕc òmnia vênérunt super nos
column3: et iníqŭe non égimus in testamènto tuo. ^ All these things have come upon us
column4: yet we have not forgotten thee
column5: and we have not done wickedly in thy covenant.

column1: 19 ^ Et non recèssit retro cor nostrum
column2: et declinavìsti sémitas nostras a via tua
column3: ^ And our heart hath not turned back
column4: and thou hast diverted our steps from thy way

column1: 20 ^ qŭóniam humiliavìsti nos in loco afflictiónis
column2: et coopèruit nos ùmbra mortis. ^ for thou hast humbled us in the place of affliction
column3: and the shadow of death hath covered us.

column1: 21 ^ Si oblíti sùmus nomen Dei nostri
column2: et si expándimus manûs nostras ad deum aliénum
column3: ^ If we have forgotten the name of our God
column4: and if we have spread forth our hands to a strange god

column1: 22 ^ ¿~nonne Deus requíret ìsta~? Ìpse ènim novit abscòndita cordis. ^ shall not God search out these things~? For he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
23 ^ Qŭóniam pròpter te mortificámur tota die~; aĕstimáti sùmus sicut oves occaĕsiónis. ^ Because for thy sake we are killed all the day long~; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
24 ^ Exsùrge~; ¿~quare obdórmîs
column2: Dòmine~? Exsùrge et ne repèllas in finem. ^ Arise~; why sleepest thou
column3: O Lord~? Arise and cast us not off to the end.

column1: 25 ^ ¿~Qŭare fáciem tuam avèrtis~? ¿~Oblivísceris inópiaĕ nostraĕ et tribulatiónis nostraĕ~? ^ Why turnest thou thy face away~? Why forgettest our want and our trouble~?
26 ^ Qŭóniam humiliáta est in pùlvere ánima nostra~; conglutinátus est in terra vènter noster. ^ For our soul is humbled down to the dust~; our belly cleaveth to the earth.
27 ^ Exsùrge
column4: et rèdime nos pròpter nomen tuum. ^ Arise
column7: and redeem us for thy name's sake.
